page.title: 16The National Park.
page.content: The Pembrokshire Coast National Park is an organization to help promote tourism and to keep the natural beauty of the coastal path from being destroyed.The actual coastal path stretches a massive 168 miles around the Pembrokshire coast outlining most of the 225 square miles of Dyfed that the National Park covers.The population of the area of the park is about 20,000 people which is high by any National Park's standards.In the year 1952 it was finally designated a National Park.Such places as the Preselies are covered by the park and there are many islands such as Ramsey,Skomer,Grassholm and Skokholm which supports large numbers of wildlife.I hope that the National Park carries on with the good work in the future.
